Quick search

Enter search terms or a module, class or function name.

graph¶

efficient Euclidian Graphs for NetworkX and related algorithms

class graph.GeoGraph(G=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: networkx.classes.multigraph.MultiGraph

a Graph with nodes at specified positions. if edges have a “length” attribute, it is used to compute distances, otherwise euclidian distance between nodes is used by default

Parameters:
  • multi – boolean to control if multiple edges between nodes are allowed (True) or not (False)
  • **kwargs –

    other parameters will be copied as attributes

Parameters:
  • multi – boolean to control if multiple edges between nodes are allowed (True) or not (False)
  • **kwargs –

    other parameters will be copied as attributes
copy()[source]¶

does not use deepcopy because the rtree index must be rebuilt

nodes closest to a given position :param p: (x,y) position tuple :param skip: optional bool to skip n :return: list of nodes

must be here because Graph.add_nodes_from doesn’t call add_node cleanly as it should...

Parameters:n – node tuple

remove node from graph and rtree

add_edge(u, v, attr_dict={}, **attrs)[source]¶

add an edge to graph :return: edge data from created or existing edge side effect: updates largest merge in self.max_merge

remove_edge(u, v=None, clean=False)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • u – Node or Edge (Nodes tuple)
  • v – Node if u is a single Node
  • clean – bool removes disconnected nodes. must be False for certain nx algos to work

remove edge from graph. NetworkX graphs do not remove unused nodes

graph.figure(g, **kwargs)[source]¶
Returns:matplotlib axis suitable for drawing graph g
graph.draw_networkx(g, **kwargs)[source]¶

improves draw_networkx :param g: NetworkX Graph :param pos: can be either :

  • optional dictionary of (x,y) node positions
  • function of the form lambda node:(x,y) that maps node positions.
  • None. in this case, nodes are directly used as positions if graph is a GeoGraph, otherwise nx.draw_shell is used
Parameters:
  • fig – matplotlib figure. If None, figure(g) is used to obtain one
  • **kwargs –

    passed to nx.draw method with one tweak:
  • if edge_color is a function of the form lambda data:color string, it is mapped over all edges
graph.delauney_triangulation(nodes, **kwargs)[source]¶
Parameters:nodes – list of (x,y) nodes positions
Returns:geograph with minimum spanning tree between nodes

see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delaunay_triangulation
